intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium acrocaustum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture, and its flowers are yellow, arranged in a single head. It is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
